avalancheActivity.comment:
In particular along the border with France, along the border with Switzerland snowfall to low altitudes. The foehn wind will transport the new snow. In the course of the day the wind slabs will increase in size additionally. They are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.

The wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. In the regions exposed to precipitation this applies in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase in particular in the regions exposed to the foehn.

Avalanches can in isolated cases be triggered in the old snowpack and reach quite a large size.

Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack are a clear indication of a weakly bonded snowpack.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Strong foehn wind: Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and strong wind. Snow sport activities outside marked and open pistes call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The northwesterly wind will transport the new snow and, in some cases, old snow as well. In the course of the day wind slabs will form in all aspects. Explanation: "these" may only stand for "these wind slabs" are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
In addition, snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Large-grained weak layers exist in the old snowpack on shady slopes.

tendency.highlights: On wind-loaded slopes a considerable danger of dry avalanches will prevail. This applies in particular, in the regions that are exposed to the foehn wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Wind and new snow: In particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain further wind slabs will form. The fresh and older wind slabs represent the main danger. They are to be assessed critically.
Avalanches can in some places be released, in particular by large loads and reach medium size.
Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack are a clear indication of a weakly bonded snowpack.

The numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow are the main danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind will be strong. Fresh and older wind slabs require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Fresh and older wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack in all altitude zones. Large-grained weak layers exist in the old snowpack on shady slopes. The old snowpack remains subject to considerable local variations at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
Below approximately 2000 m less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.highlights: Increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and strong wind. This applies especially in the regions exposed to the foehn wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The strong wind will transport the old snow. The hard wind slabs can be released in particular on very steep shady slopes and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. Fresh and older wind slabs have formed in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Along the border with France the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent and the danger is greater.

Isolated gliding avalanches are possible in particular below approximately 1800 m. Caution is to be exercised in areas with glide cracks.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh and somewhat older wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: As a consequence of solar radiation the snowpack settled during the last few days. Towards its surface, the snowpack is favourably layered and its surface has a strong crust. This applies in particular on sunny slopes at low and intermediate altitudes. In addition hard wind slabs formed in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in the high Alpine regions. Especially at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

tendency.highlights: In the regions exposed to the foehn wind the size of the avalanche prone locations will increase on Friday. In the regions exposed to snowfall this applies in particular along the border with France.
